short_reason: Expanded immunity for official acts narrows executive accountability.
Guard deployment posture near peaceful demonstrations raised coercion concerns.
Procedural games around certification but results ultimately held.
Pattern of investigations concentrated on opposition figures while similar behavior by allies is ignored.
Use of regulatory threats and selective contracts to pressure media and business opponents.
Harsh rhetoric toward independent media and sporadic access restrictions raise press freedom concerns.
New biometric checkpoints deployed at major airports without clear civil-liberties safeguards.
Coordinated pressure on independent agencies to narrow the scope of permissible protests near federal facilities.
Selective prosecution patterns reported against specific advocacy groups challenging federal security policy.
Budget reallocation increases funding for opaque security programs while cutting independent oversight bodies.
Fast-track procedures used to renew emergency powers with limited floor debate and public scrutiny.
Regulatory changes expand content takedown pathways for platforms based on broad notions of national security.
